---
title: "{{< var title >}}: {{< var version >}}"
subtitle: "TOC"
author: "{{< var author.name >}}"
date: "`r Sys.Date()`"
format:
  html: default
  gfm: default
---

```{r}
#| label: setup
#| echo: false
#| message: false
#| results: 'asis'

library("fs")
library("here")

url_root <- "https://www.jvcasillas.com/morph_pred_hs"

dplyr::bind_rows(
  dir_ls(path = here("scripts"), regexp = "\\.html$") |> 
    tibble::as_tibble(), 
  dir_ls(path = here("docs"), regexp = "\\.html$") |> 
    tibble::as_tibble() 
) |> 
  dplyr::mutate(order = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 5)) |>
  dplyr::arrange(order) |>
  dplyr::mutate(names = c(
      "1. [Proficiency/use clean up and EDA]",
      "2. [Tidy eye-tracking data]",
      "3. [GAMMs]",
      "4. [Beta regression]", 
      "5. [Summary]", 
      "6. [Write-up]"
    ), 
    value = stringr::str_remove_all(value, glue::glue("{here()}")), 
    path = glue::glue("({url_root}{value})"), 
    link = glue::glue("{names}{path}")) |> 
  dplyr::pull(link)

```

A PDF version of the summary is available [here](https://www.jvcasillas.com/morph_pred_hs/docs/summary.pdf)
